DOC.detailed_description: Settings : Cambodia , Côte d'Ivoire , Uganda , Vietnam . Design : Multicentre , two-arm , unblinded randomize controlled superiority trial . Objective : To compare 24-week risk death occurrence invasive bacterial infection two experimental strategy HIV-1 infect adult start ART CD4 count < 100/mm3 : ( ) continuous extensive TB screen follow-up time patient present symptom , versus ( ii ) systematic empirical TB treatment start 2 week ART initiation . Trial strategy : At inclusion , participant randomize 1:1 two strategy TB test treatment : extensive TB screening , systematic empirical TB treatment . Extensive TB screening ( arm 1 ) : In arm : - TB screen point-of-care test ( Xpert MTB/RIF® , urine LAM ) chest X-ray use extensively randomisation ( patient ) follow-up ( patient sign symptom suggestive TB ) ; - Only patient meet standardized criterion TB inclusion follow-up receive standard TB treatment ( 2ERHZ/4RH ) ; - ART ( tenofovir ( TDF ) -lamivudine ( 3TC ) /emtricitabine ( FTC ) zidovudine ( AZT ) -lamivudine+ efavirenz ) start immediately randomization patient put TB treatment , 2 week initiation TB treatment others . Systematic empirical TB treatment ( arm 2 ) : In arm : - TB screen point-of-care test use ; - All patient start 6-month standard TB treatment ( 2ERHZ/4RH ) randomization ; ART ( tenofovir-lamivudine/emtricitabine zidovudine-lamivudine+ efavirenz ) start 2 week TB treatment initiation .
